title: Andreotti–Frankel theorem
summary: In mathematics, the Andreotti–Frankel theorem, introduced by Aldo Andreotti and Theodore Frankel (1959), states that if V {\displaystyle V} is a smooth, complex affine variety of complex dimension n {\displaystyle n} or, more generally, if V {\displaystyle V} is any Stein manifold of dimension n {\displaystyle n} , then V {\displaystyle V} admits a Morse function with critical points of index at most n, and so V {\displaystyle V} is homotopy equivalent to a CW complex of real dimension at most n.
